revised_title: Investigation of Sound Transmission in the Atmosphere and Fog-Signals
tldr: John Tyndall investigates the transmission of sound through the atmosphere and tests various fog signals, including horns, whistles, and guns. He discovers that the effectiveness of these signals varies greatly depending on atmospheric conditions and that the acoustic transparency of the air can change rapidly. Tyndall also observes that audible echoes can be reflected from an optically transparent atmosphere.
